content:
re :in month view, one of the days is colored purple and I'm not sure why.

That is to tell you that coloured purple day is Today. It helps you to find the current week when in 'Month' view.

re :I prefer to have the current week at the top of the Calendar view but haven't figured a way to do this.

Select 'Multiweek' tab The current week appears at the top.

content:
Yes, If you use Excel or similar spreadsheet, this macro should do it: 

 =replace(replace(XX,4,0,"-"),8,0,"-")   where XX represents the cell of the topmost phone number. The format assumes three digits for area-code followed by seven-digit number.  Then, highlight and drag down the rest of the column. If you have another spreadsheet, there is likely a similar macro to 'replace.'

content: Look in the saved folders for the Mail\ folder and in the Mail\Local Folders folder. That is where POP and non-account folders are stored, e.g., INSURANCE and insurance.msf, etc. You can move those to the active profile in similar locations but do it when thunderbird is not running.

content:
Those are your backup folders. But also, those wdseml files are only the Windows Desktop Search Email files, not your actual emails. If I remember correctly your emails live in your "Profile" folder. You need to locate your actual Thunderbird "Profile" folder in your c drive. Once your place those backup folders correctly into your profile folder, you should be able to read them all again properly. Read through the knowledge base articles on how to backup and recover your files when moving a profile. It's been a while since I looked at that, but there should be links here someplace... found 

a couple

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/thunderbird/install-migrate-and-update https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles

One specific takeaway, when doing anything within your profile folders, you should have Thunderbird shut down. Not just minimized. You probably will have to also "show hidden files" in order to see all locations.

Let me know if you have more questions after reading the kb articles. Hope this helps. Marc

content: My only thought is to check the date/time settings on the new PC.
creator: davidsk

content:
The computer was purchased as a refurb (deal to great to resist) so unfortunately no warranty or support. I went to Control Panel/Date & Time where - much to my surprise - the machine was sent to PST but the clock was set to CST. That's why the clock in the lower left of the Taskbar was showing me the correct local time and had me assuming the whole machine was in CST. My only guess is that the prior owner did some type of manual adjustment to the time rather than swapping time zones.

So many hours wasted on this....ARGHHHH!!!!

Thanks for the assist!
creator: weathervane

content: We're always glad to assist. Glad you got it all working now.  :)

content: If you have the release level, try tools>import>import a file>import addressbook>import sqlite and then select the abook dot sqlite file from your release profile (while thunderbird is not running. OR, if you're comfortable in Windows File manager, copy abook.* from the release version and paste in same location in beta version. I regret you had this difficult.

content:
Uninstall beta program Install current release, but DO NOT allow the auto start. This is important. You will need to start Thunderbird in a different way to allow the downgrade.

starting Thunderbird with "--allow-downgrade"


In Windows, search type: run select the 'Run' app type: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade (Note: there is a space before and after -P) click on OK

Additional info: https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/beta/Tb1ebd793e1cebf1e-M2e41abc59f3d1619db4a5ecf
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Gsatman said
How can I delete this new beta version of thunder bird , it has my system in a mess..My email box is empty of all my old emails but i find them in a all mail folder..
  • Please confirm you are using a gmail account, configured as imap.
  • Do you have more than one email account?
  • Please confirm - does the folder pane header show "Unified Folders"?

Gsatman said
When I reply to someone that reply goes to the top of my incoming email..

So your replies are shown in your Inbox?

As for going back to your previous version...if you installed beta in the normal manner, then your previous version and all its data is still available. You can run both beta and the previous version at the same time.
